thread.title: Trump Attacks Freedom Caucus On Twitter: ‘We Must Fight’
thread.title_full: Trump Attacks Freedom Caucus On Twitter: ‘We Must Fight’

author: Charles Campbell
title: Trump Attacks Freedom Caucus On Twitter: ‘We Must Fight’
text:
To Start 2017, Fox Posts Highest-Watched Quarter Ever 
Ongoing tensions within the Republican party came to a boiling point after Trump’s health care billed failed to pass. The no compromise brand of conservatism inherent to members of the Freedom Caucus has fueled resentment among Republicans who wish to pass legislation that can easily pass both the House and Senate. 
While some have attacked Meadows on his stubbornness, the GOP lawmaker admitted he is open to compromise as long as the bill is not rushed. I'm still hopeful we can change the bill–I'll continue working around the clock to do so. But I cannot support the #AHCA as it stands. https://t.co/ntbFgggiPu 
— Mark Meadows (@RepMarkMeadows) March 22, 2017 
“There’s a real commitment among members he’s been speaking with to not give up and move expeditiously toward a path forward,” his spokeswoman, Alyssa Farah, said. “But he doesn’t want to constrain himself to artificial deadlines like ‘before recess.’” 
An alternative option for Trump is to seek help from Democrats who have expressed being receptive to negotiations. However, the caveat is that Trump must be willing to reform Obamacare and not scrap it. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below.
